# Arc diagram


An arc diagram visualizes a network using a one-dimensional layout of nodes and circular arcs to represent links. Though an arc diagram may not always convey the overall structure of the graphs as effectively as a two-dimensional layout, with a good ordering of nodes one can identify cliques and bridges. 


Arc diagrams were originally invented to depict repeated musical structures <a href="https://turbulence.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/Martin-Wattenberg-Shape-of-Song.pdf" target="_blank"> The Shape of Song </a> published by Martin Wattenberg.
